text: S is a high-level programming language which is used to analyze statistics. The paid software programs called S-PLUS are based on the S language. Other programming languages, including the free R language, are based on S. ==History== The S language was developed in the 1970s at Bell Laboratories by John Chambers and other programmers including Trevor Hastie. ==References== Category:High-level programming languages
title: S (programming language)
